children.text: Name switch ports where APs and other switches are connected, based on their LLDP neighbors. Assuming Marriott GPNS VLANs 100 and 101.
Get all switch configuration files at once.

Network automation tool that dynamically configures switchports based on defined criteria. Create rules by specifying conditions (such as LLDP neighbor MAC, port description, etc.) and actions (VLAN assignment, port status, etc.). Select target switches and the system automatically scans and applies configurations to matching ports every 5 minutes in the background until you stop or delete the rule.

Get all switch configuration files at once.

Network automation tool that dynamically configures switchports based on defined criteria. Create rules by specifying conditions (such as LLDP neighbor MAC, port description, etc.) and actions (VLAN assignment, port status, etc.). Select target switches and the system automatically scans and applies configurations to matching ports every 5 minutes in the background until you stop or delete the rule.

children.text:
Developed by: Mansour Elsayeh
 GuestTek Interactive Entertainment
All rights reserved.

NetSwift 2.0 is an advanced, automation-driven network management platform designed to simplify and accelerate daily operations across large-scale enterprise switching environments. Built for Aruba AOS-CX networks, the system delivers real-time visibility, intelligent automation, and powerful configuration workflows  all through a modern API-based architecture.

The backend engine provides parallel switch discovery, multi-threaded port scanning, and high-performance database operations, allowing the platform to map entire networks within seconds. NetSwift 2.0 also includes automated VLAN synchronization, IPv4/IPv6 ACL deployment, and port-level configuration enforcement, including 802.1X, MAC authentication, PoE control, STP features, and LLDP neighbor resolution.

The platform streamlines complex tasks such as switch onboarding, configuration auditing, port management, and real-time status monitoring  reducing manual workload and helping engineers maintain consistent, secure, and scalable network configurations across all sites.

This will permanently remove the        
       selcted VLAN from  switches!

actionConfiguration.body:
{
  "banner": {{bannerMotd.text || null}},
  "timezone": {{timezoneSelect.selectedOptionValue || null}},
  "ntp_enabled": {{isNtp.isChecked}},
  "ntp_servers": {{[priNtp.text, secNtp.text].filter(s => s && s.trim() !== "")}},
  "radius_servers": {{[{"address": radiusAdd1.text, "auth_port": parseInt(radiusAuthPort1.text) || 1812, "key": radiusKey1.text, "group": radiusGroup1.text}, {"address": radiusAdd2.text, "auth_port": parseInt(radiusAuthPort2.text) || 1814, "key": radiusKey2.text, "group": radiusGroup2.text}].filter(r => r.address && r.address.trim() !== "")}},
  "logging_servers": {{[{"host_address": logServer1.text, "severity": logSev1.selectedOptionValue}, {"host_address": logServer2.text, "severity": logSev2.selectedOptionValue}].filter(l => l.host_address && l.host_address.trim() !== "")}},
  "acl_mgmt": {{aclMgmt.text || null}},
  "acl_portiso": {{ipv4AclRules.text || null}},
  "acl_ipv6_portiso": {{ipv6AclRules.text || null}},
  "dhcp_snooping_enabled": {{isDhcpSnooping.isChecked}},
  "stp_enabled": {{isStp.isChecked}},
  "stp_config_name": {{stpConfigName.text || null}},
  "stp_config_revision": {{parseInt(stpConfigRev.text) || null}},
  "aaa_dot1x_enabled": {{is_dot1xAuth.isChecked}},
  "aaa_dot1x_group": {{dot1xSrvGrp.text || null}},
  "aaa_mac_auth_enabled": {{is_macAuth.isChecked}},
  "aaa_mac_auth_group": {{macSrvGrp.text || null}},
  "snmp_system_description": {{sysDesc.text || null}},
  "snmp_system_location": {{sysLoc.text || null}},
  "snmp_system_contact": {{sysContact.text || null}},
  "snmp_communities": {{[{"community": snmpcomm1.text}, {"community": snmpcomm2.text}, {"community": snmpcomm3.text}].filter(c => c.community && c.community.trim() !== "")}},
  "snmp_servers": {{[{"server": snmpServer1.text}, {"server": snmpServer2.text}, {"server": snmpServer3.text}].filter(s => s.server && s.server.trim() !== "")}},
  "apply_on": {{applySelect.selectedOptionValue}},
  "switches": {{applySelect.selectedOptionValue === "specific" ? selectedSwitches.selectedOptionValues : null}}
}

        "Zulu"
    ],

    // -------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // 2. Internal Utility Functions
    // -------------------------------------------------------------------------

    /**
     * Utility function to convert a string (potentially with underscores) to Title Case.
     */
    titleCase(s) {
        if (!s) return '';
        // Replace underscores with spaces, then split by space
        return s.split('_')
                .map(word => {
                    // Handle acronyms/all-caps parts like GMT, UCT, etc.
                    if (word.toUpperCase() === word && word.length > 1) {
                        return word;
                    }
                    // Otherwise, capitalize the first letter and keep the rest as-is
                    return word.charAt(0).toUpperCase() + word.slice(1);
                })
                .join(' ');
    },

    /**
     * Utility to create the display label (e.g., "America/Buenos Aires")
     */
    createLabel(tz) {
        // Split by the main timezone separator (slash)
        const parts = tz.split('/');

        // Apply title casing to each segment (handling words separated by underscores)
        const labelParts = parts.map(part => this.titleCase(part));

        // Rejoin with the slash
        return labelParts.join('/');
    },

    // -------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // 3. Exported Primary Function
    // -------------------------------------------------------------------------

    /**
     * Converts the raw timezone list into an array of Label:Value objects suitable for a dropdown.
     */
    getTimezoneOptions() {
        return this.Timezones.map(tz => ({
            // The Label is formatted for user readability
            label: this.createLabel(tz),
            // The Value is the original ID, converted to all lowercase for consistent storage
            value: tz.toLowerCase()
        }));
    }
};

    // -------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // 2. Internal Utility Functions
    // -------------------------------------------------------------------------

    /**
     * Utility function to convert a string (potentially with underscores) to Title Case.
     */
    titleCase(s) {
        if (!s) return '';
        // Replace underscores with spaces, then split by space
        return s.split('_')
                .map(word => {
                    // Handle acronyms/all-caps parts like GMT, UCT, etc.
                    if (word.toUpperCase() === word && word.length > 1) {
                        return word;
                    }
                    // Otherwise, capitalize the first letter and keep the rest as-is
                    return word.charAt(0).toUpperCase() + word.slice(1);
                })
                .join(' ');
    },

    /**
     * Utility to create the display label (e.g., "America/Buenos Aires")
     */
    createLabel(tz) {
        // Split by the main timezone separator (slash)
        const parts = tz.split('/');

        // Apply title casing to each segment (handling words separated by underscores)
        const labelParts = parts.map(part => this.titleCase(part));

        // Rejoin with the slash
        return labelParts.join('/');
    },

    // -------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // 3. Exported Primary Function
    // -------------------------------------------------------------------------

    /**
     * Converts the raw timezone list into an array of Label:Value objects suitable for a dropdown.
     */
    getTimezoneOptions() {
        return this.Timezones.map(tz => ({
            // The Label is formatted for user readability
            label: this.createLabel(tz),
            // The Value is the original ID, converted to all lowercase for consistent storage
            value: tz.toLowerCase()
        }));
    }
};
